intro: Nasturtium stylatum, commonly known as the slender nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange or yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is known for its peppery taste, similar to watercress, which makes it edible. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing as a climbing or trailing plant. Nasturtium stylatum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial insects to gardens.
